channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Minnesota immigration crackdown will end, border czar says. And, DHS funding to expire
item.description: Border czar Tom Homan announced that the Trump administration will end the immigration crackdown in Minnesota. And, DHS funding is set to expire after lawmakers failed to advance a spending bill.
item.content:encoded:
Border czar Tom Homan announced that the Trump administration will end the immigration crackdown in Minnesota. And, DHS funding is set to expire after lawmakers failed to advance a spending bill.

(Image credit: Steve Karnowski)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen

item.title: Britain's High Court says government illegally banned Pro-Palestinian group
item.description: In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."
item.content:encoded:
In its ruling, the court said an earlier decision to ban the Pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action as a terrorist organization was "disproportionate."

(Image credit: Kirsty Wigglesworth)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: On their way! 4 people on NASA Crew-12 mission launch to International Space Station
item.description: The four are set to dock with the space station on Saturday, returning the orbital lab to its full complement of seven. NASA's last mission, Crew-11, left a month early due to an ill crew member.
item.content:encoded:
The four are set to dock with the space station on Saturday, returning the orbital lab to its full complement of seven. NASA's last mission, Crew-11, left a month early due to an ill crew member.

(Image credit: SpaceX via NASA)
item.dc:creator: Russell Lewis

item.title: Can you medal in quiz? Go for the gold!
item.description: Plus: more Olympics, the Super Bowl and some monks.
item.content:encoded: Plus: more Olympics, the Super Bowl and some monks.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Who will police Gaza, and how?
item.description: Under President Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan, Arab countries and the European Union are supposed to train a new police force in the Gaza Strip. But U.S. plans have run into serious challenges.
item.content:encoded:
Under President Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan, Arab countries and the European Union are supposed to train a new police force in the Gaza Strip. But U.S. plans have run into serious challenges.

(Image credit: Majdi Mohammed)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: A bipartisan effort to save health subsidies failed. Will ICE reform be different?
item.description: A bipartisan effort in Congress to restrain immigration enforcement tactics is flailing despite a Friday deadline to fund the Department of Homeland Security. The pattern is increasingly familiar.
item.content:encoded:
A bipartisan effort in Congress to restrain immigration enforcement tactics is flailing despite a Friday deadline to fund the Department of Homeland Security. The pattern is increasingly familiar.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: RFK Jr. made promises to get his job as health secretary. He's broken many of them
item.description: In his confirmation hearings, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. told U.S. senators that he would not cut funding for vaccine research or change the nation's official vaccine recommendations. He did both.
item.content:encoded:
In his confirmation hearings, Robert F. Kennedy Jr. told U.S. senators that he would not cut funding for vaccine research or change the nation's official vaccine recommendations. He did both.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Amanda Seitz

item.title: Oldest living married couple shares their love story
item.description: For StoryCorps, a husband and wife, who are both more than 100 years old, talk about how they met and fell in love.
item.content:encoded: For StoryCorps, a husband and wife, who are both more than 100 years old, talk about how they met and fell in love.
item.dc:creator: Jo Corona

item.title: Goldman Sachs' top lawyer to resign after emails show close ties to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Kathy Ruemmler, a former White House counsel to President Obama, says she will resign from Goldman Sachs after emails between her and Jeffrey Epstein showed a close relationship between the pair.
item.content:encoded:
Kathy Ruemmler, a former White House counsel to President Obama, says she will resign from Goldman Sachs after emails between her and Jeffrey Epstein showed a close relationship between the pair.

(Image credit: Charles Dharapak)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump pardons 5 former NFL players for crimes ranging from perjury to drug trafficking
item.description: Those pardoned include ex-NFL players Joe Klecko, Nate Newton, Jamal Lewis, Travis Henry and the late Billy Cannon.
item.content:encoded:
Those pardoned include ex-NFL players Joe Klecko, Nate Newton, Jamal Lewis, Travis Henry and the late Billy Cannon.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
